Detailed Description

User analysis template.

This object merges signal and pile-up events and provide a user hooks for analysis 

 {.cpp}
    UserAnalysisBase::book();                 // book histograms etc.
    UserAnalysisBase::analyze(Event& pEvt);   // analysis
    UserAnalysisBase::write()                 // write out histograms

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

UserAnalysisBase::UserAnalysisBase ( const std::string &  name,
DataFrame *  dataServer 
)

Single server constructor.

This constructor is useful if only one input stream is used. In this case the default event type is Vertex::SIGNAL. Collisions are merged according to the configured mu.

Parameters:
[in] name name of analysis
[in] dataServer pointer to data server

UserAnalysisBase::UserAnalysisBase ( const std::string &  name,
DataFrame *  signalServer,
DataFrame *  pileupServer 
)

Dual server constructor.

This constructor can be used if two input streams are used. In this case the first data stream argument specifies the Vertex::SIGNAL events, while the second argument specifies the Vertex::PILEUP events. Note that the configured mu only acts on the pile-up stream. The number of signal events per merged event is fixed to 1.

Member Function Documentation

bool UserAnalysisBase::analyze ( Event &  pEvt  )  [virtual]

Analysis.

This method should be implemented by the client. The default implementation fills the HistGroupEvent groups of histograms are filled.

Reimplemented in HZAnalysis, and TestFilterAnalysis.

bool UserAnalysisBase::book (  )  [virtual]

Booking.

This method should be implemented by the client. By default, a set of histograms defined in HistGroupEvent is booked for each available input stream and the merged event (if available) separately.

Reimplemented in HZAnalysis, and TestFilterAnalysis.

bool UserAnalysisBase::process (  )  [virtual]

Process loop.

This method executes the principal process loop. While it can be overwritten by clients, it is highly recommended to only have this done by experts.

This method loops on the input stream(s) according to the configuration specified at construction. For each completely converted input event, which features

  • single stream input : mu collisions per event;
  • dual stream input : 1 signal collision + mu pile-up collisions per event,

the UserAnalysisBase::analysis method is invoked with a reference to the actual Event. The Event cache is cleared after that. In addition, the fTicker method is invoked for regular logging and/or output file updates.
